intro: Babiana stricta var. villosa, commonly known as the woolly babiana, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves covered in fine, woolly hairs, giving it its common name. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Babiana stricta var. villosa is a perennial plant that produces showy inflorescences during the summer months.
